required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: uPAR PET/CT in Radium-223-dichloride Treatment of Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: uPAR PET/CT in Radium-223-dichloride Treatment of Patients With Metastatic Castration-resistant Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate the applicability of urokinase plasminogen activator receptor (uPAR) Positron Emission Tomography (PET) / CT molecular imaging in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC)

detailed_description.textblock: 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 is a radioligand targeting urokinase plasminogen activator receptor (uPAR), which is a promising imaging biomarker of tumor aggressiveness. 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 PET/CT will be applied in patients with mCRPC during treatment with Radium-223. PET/CT will be performed before initiation of Radium therapy and after two treatment cycles. The initial semiquantitative uptake (standard uptake values, SUVs) of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 in metastases as well as the change in these parameters after therapy will be correlated with overall survival and progression free survival.

primary_outcome.description: Standard uptake values (SUVs) of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 evaluated on uPAR-PET/CT scan performed within 1 hour following injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uPAR PET/CT after two cycles of Radium-223
primary_outcome.description: Change in Standard uptake values (SUVs) of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 evaluated on uPAR-PET/CT scan performed after 2 cycles of Radium-223 therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: uPAR PET/CT as prognostic factor for overall survival
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be followed for 12 months after uPAR PET/CT

secondary_outcome.measure: uPAR PET/CT as prognostic factor for progression free survival
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will be followed for 12 months after uPAR PET/CT

arm_group.description: Injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 followed by PET/CT scan. Administration will be performed twice in approximately 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Following injection of 68Ga-NOTA-AE105 the patients will be subjected to whole body PET/CT

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic castration resistant prostate cancer
- Approved to receive Radium-223 therapy
- Written and oral consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lack of communication skills
- Other known malignant disease
- Known allergy towards IMP
- Severe claustrophobia
- If a participant exhibits allergic reaction i the IMP, the participant will be excluded from further participation in the study

overall_official.affiliation: Rigshospitalet, Department of Clinical Physiology, Nuclear Medicine & PET
